data.author: Heiko Hirschmueller
data.message:
Workaround for Baumer GenTL GEV interface enumeration bug.

The bug leads to unbounded allocation of memory upon calling TLUpdateInterfaceList().
As a temporary workaround, interfaces will only be enumerated once and kept open
until all systems resources are cleared by System::clearSystems() call. The drawback
of this workaround is that the list of interfaces will be wrong if interfaces are
created or deleted after first enumeration.

data.author: Felix Ruess
data.message:
update GEV GenTL provider from Baumer

to version included in 2.9.0.18905

most important changes/fixes:
- uses GenICam reference implementation parser
- correct handling of strings which use full register length (e.g. DeviceUserID)
- Fixed a stability problem with the resend algorithm, if the GEV device sends invalid BlockIDs.
- Fixed a problem with invoke the maximum allowed packet size of a GEV device.
- Fixed a problem when more than one network adapters using the same subnet.

closes SW-288
closes SENS-343

data.author: Felix Ruess
data.message:
try to fix architecture detection

using the host archtecture (from the kernel) doesn't work if we are e.g.
building in docker for i686
So we assume that the compiler (on UNIX) has a `-dumpmachine` command and use that to
extract the architecture.
